intro: Eriogonum rosense var. beatleyae, commonly known as the Beatley's roseleaf buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its pink to reddish flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, known for its distinctive seed structures. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is often found in arid environments.
